Environment

Class ScoreBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Environment.ScoreBoard

  • public class ScoreBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    The Window at the end of the game to show your final score.
    Author:
    Benjamin Thurber, Blake Kayser

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScoreBoard(GameEnvironment environment)
      Create the application.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeWindow()
      Closes the ScoreBoard window variable
      void finishedWindow()
      Closes ScoreBoard and exits.

      Closes ScoreBoard and restarts the game.

      Returns the final score from playing the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScoreBoard

        public ScoreBoard(GameEnvironment environment)
        Create the application.
        Parameters:
        environment - the current GameEnvironment

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Launch the application.
        Parameters:
        args - runtime arguments

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow()
        Closes the ScoreBoard window variable

      • finishedWindow

        public void finishedWindow()
        Closes ScoreBoard and exits. Method called when window needs to be closed, and the game quits

      • finishedWindowAndRestartGame

        public void finishedWindowAndRestartGame()
        Closes ScoreBoard and restarts the game. Method called when window needs to be closed, and game restarted

      • getFinalScore

        public int getFinalScore()
        Returns the final score from playing the game. To calculate the score, uses the percent number of crew alive of total, the total amount of shield lost for the while game, the percent number of parts found of total, the percent number of days left of total.
        Returns:
        an integer the final score (a somewhat arbitrary number representing the score)
